text: nothing more fragrant or delicious than
a perfectly ripe pear and today I'm
going to use these delicious pears to
make a super simple very fast dessert
for my lovely Valentine it's extremely
easy the first thing you do you take
three pears and cut them into quarters
leave the skins on so make sure that
they're nice and clean and then take
firm but ripe pears they shouldn't be
under ripe because if they're under ripe
they won't cook nicely so make sure you
buy them a couple days ahead of time and
let them soften because most of the time
pears at the store are not perfectly
right and scoop out the core with a
little teaspoon or however you want you
can use a knife you can use a teaspoon
your choice I like to give you choice
make sure that you do this right before
you're going to make the dessert because
pears do dis color very very quickly and
you wouldn't want that even though you
are caramelizing them they're gonna get
brown anyway but you want them to be
good Brown not discolored Brown two
totally different things one good one
bad melt the three tablespoons of butter
in a large skillet everything's gonna
get made right in here medium
medium-high heat add the pears one cut
side down the butter is not completely
melted yet but that's okay then just let
them cook until they're golden brown on
one side that should take crudo no three
minutes now turn it down to medium but
you're trying to surround them and
soften them without the butter burning
after three minutes turn them over to
the second cut side you can see that
they're nice and golden brown
they're starting to be soft they're

water
swirl that around and then turn your
